text: Acetamide is a chemical compound made of carbon, hydrogen, oxygen, and nitrogen. It is the primary amide of acetic acid. Acetamide can be found as a mineral that is either colorless or gray in color, and is made of a crystalline crust on black shale. It is named for acetic acid and ammonia. It can be found in Russia and is not radioactive. ==References== Category:Amides Category:Organic minerals
title: Acetamide
